title: Farm Machine Safety: Loader and Skid Steer Safety

tasks.task: Safely operating farm loaders and skid steer loaders
subtasks: Equip the loader with a rollover protection device (ROPS)
Do not exceed maximum load limits specified in operator's manuals
Check tire spacing and rear ballast before use
Always wear a seat belt when operating tractor and loader
Lower the bucket when turning or on uneven surfaces
Understand how load position affects center of gravity and stability
Raise and lower loads gradually to prevent tipping
Be cautious when moving loads near people and secure them properly
Adjust driving practices on slopes to prevent tipping
Keep loads low while transporting on public roads
Use appropriate warning devices when driving on public roads
Do not use front-end loaders to move large round bales without proper attachments
Keep bales low while moving to prevent accidents
Engage parking brake or place transmission in park during loader service
Avoid service under a raised loader, bucket, or attachment without securing it
Check for hydraulic leaks by applying pressure and searching with cardboard

tasks.task: Follow safety precautions for loader attachments
subtasks: Use approved bale handling attachments when moving round bales
Inspect for pinch points and rotating parts before servicing
Use personal protective equipment when handling high-pressure hydraulic systems
